reviews.text:
What a great atmosphere when you walk into this Italian restaurant. It‚Äôs as if you entered into a small Italy town.

Their pizza ranges from small to the largest pizza you'd have ever seen... 24+ inches.

Came with my family here and ordered 4 medium (14 inches), unique pizzas. Each looked better than the other.

When we started separating each slice the melted cheese kept getting longer the more you pulled the slice.

We had Cimino's Deluxe, Spaghetti Pizza, Taco Pizza and Cheese Pizza. Everything tasted delicious.  We couldn't even finish everything.

Our waitress was such a great personality and great sense of humor. Highly recommend Cimino's Little Italy.

Celebrated my daughters‚Äô birthdays there this evening. We love their specialty pizzas. And‚Ä¶ IT WAS HALF PRICE DESSERT NIGHT!!!  We have had large family events there over the years (baptism dinners, anniversary parties, etc). Never had a dish we didn‚Äôt like.

It was my first time visiting, but was pleasantly surprised and pleased with the entire experience! Went on a Tuesday and was excited to learn about the 2 for 1 special. I have celiac‚Äôs disease, and the menu offers several gluten free options! The caprese salad was phenomenal, and the gluten free pasta was delicious. Overall, the service was good! Will definitely be visiting regularly when around.

Came here for dinner and drinks. Ordered 20 wings and fries. Wings were very good, fries were top tier and servers/bartenders were all friendly and we never had an empty glass. The only reason I‚Äôm giving the atmosphere 3/5 stars is because they have several TVs on the wall with sports playing but wouldn‚Äôt turn the volume on and they didn‚Äôt have a jukebox‚Ä¶ just a preset playlist that played throughout the restaurant.

I Usually go here for salads which are 11$ then i add salmon so about $17 , I ordered a salad and im highly dissappointed, today it was terrible!!! Salmon was hard & dry had no flavor, barely gave me a salad very bare Minnum lettuce was see through the container was not worth almost $20 , if you worked 04/14/2025

editorial_summary.overview: Veteran spot for pizza, pasta, bar food & sandwiches with full bar, an enclosed atrium & a patio.

recentReviews.author: Cody LaBorence
recentReviews.text: Came here for dinner and drinks. Ordered 20 wings and fries. Wings were very good, fries were top tier and servers/bartenders were all friendly and we never had an empty glass. The only reason I‚Äôm giving the atmosphere 3/5 stars is because they have several TVs on the wall with sports playing but wouldn‚Äôt turn the volume on and they didn‚Äôt have a jukebox‚Ä¶ just a preset playlist that played throughout the restaurant.

recentReviews.author: Courtney Greenfield
recentReviews.text: It was my first time visiting, but was pleasantly surprised and pleased with the entire experience! Went on a Tuesday and was excited to learn about the 2 for 1 special. I have celiac‚Äôs disease, and the menu offers several gluten free options! The caprese salad was phenomenal, and the gluten free pasta was delicious. Overall, the service was good! Will definitely be visiting regularly when around.

recentReviews.author: Areil H
recentReviews.text: I Usually go here for salads which are 11$ then i add salmon so about $17 , I ordered a salad and im highly dissappointed, today it was terrible!!! Salmon was hard & dry had no flavor, barely gave me a salad very bare Minnum lettuce was see through the container was not worth almost $20 , if you worked 04/14/2025

recentReviews.author: Abroad Travel
recentReviews.text:
What a great atmosphere when you walk into this Italian restaurant. It‚Äôs as if you entered into a small Italy town.

Their pizza ranges from small to the largest pizza you'd have ever seen... 24+ inches.

Came with my family here and ordered 4 medium (14 inches), unique pizzas. Each looked better than the other.

When we started separating each slice the melted cheese kept getting longer the more you pulled the slice.

We had Cimino's Deluxe, Spaghetti Pizza, Taco Pizza and Cheese Pizza. Everything tasted delicious.  We couldn't even finish everything.

Our waitress was such a great personality and great sense of humor. Highly recommend Cimino's Little Italy.

recentReviews.author: Christy Garnhart
recentReviews.text: Celebrated my daughters‚Äô birthdays there this evening. We love their specialty pizzas. And‚Ä¶ IT WAS HALF PRICE DESSERT NIGHT!!!  We have had large family events there over the years (baptism dinners, anniversary parties, etc). Never had a dish we didn‚Äôt like.

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers have positive experiences overall. Your 4.0/5 rating from 5 recent reviews shows solid satisfaction with room for growth.

strengthsPerceived: Customers rave about the unique and delicious specialty pizzas, including options like Cimino's Deluxe and Spaghetti Pizza. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
The restaurant offers enticing promotions such as half-price dessert nights and 2 for 1 specials, which customers find exciting and valuable. - Boostly marketing services can amplify this

The availability of gluten-free options, such as gluten-free pasta and phenomenal caprese salad, is highly appreciated by customers with dietary restrictions. - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility
improvementOpportunities: Lack of atmosphere/ambiance awareness due to no jukebox and preset playlist - social media marketing can improve this area
Negative review regarding poor food quality (hard & dry salmon, minimal salad) - review management can address this concern
Negative perception of value for money due to poor food quality and portion size - Boostly marketing services can improve this
